net.finmath.montecarlo.assetderivativevaluation

Class InhomogenousBachelierModelMonteCarloValuationTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.finmath.montecarlo.assetderivativevaluation.InhomogenousBachelierModelMonteCarloValuationTest

  • public class InhomogenousBachelierModelMonteCarloValuationTest
extends Object
    This class represents a collection of several "tests" illustrating different aspects related to the Monte-Carlo Simulation and derivative pricing (using a simple Bachelier model).
    Author:
    Christian Fries

      • testEuropeanAsianBermudanOption

        public void testEuropeanAsianBermudanOption()
                                     throws CalculationException
        Evaluates different options (European, Asian, Bermudan) using the given model. The options share the same maturity and strike for the at t=3.0. Observations which can be made:
        • The Asian is cheaper than the European since averaging reduces the volatility.
        • The European is cheaper than the Bermudan since exercises into the European is one (out of may) exercises strategies of the Bermudan.
        Throws:
        CalculationException - Thrown if s.th. went wrong during calculation (check getCause for details).

      • testMultiThreaddedValuation

        public void testMultiThreaddedValuation()
                                 throws InterruptedException
        Evaluates 100000 Asian options in 10 parallel threads (each valuing 10000 options)
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - Thrown if multi-threadded execution is interrupted.
